service.name: datanode_process_percent
service.label: Percent DataNodes Available
service.description: This alert is triggered if the number of down DataNodes in the cluster is greater than the configured critical threshold. It aggregates the results of DataNode process checks.

service.name: datanode_storage_percent
service.label: Percent DataNodes With Available Space
service.description: This service-level alert is triggered if the storage on a certain percentage of DataNodes exceeds either the warning or critical threshold values.

service.name: journalnode_process_percent
service.label: Percent JournalNodes Available
service.description: This alert is triggered if the number of down JournalNodes in the cluster is greater than the configured critical threshold. It aggregates the results of JournalNode process checks.

NAMENODE.name: namenode_webui
NAMENODE.label: NameNode Web UI
NAMENODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the NameNode Web UI is unreachable.

NAMENODE.name: upgrade_finalized_state
NAMENODE.label: HDFS Upgrade Finalized State
NAMENODE.description: This service-level alert is triggered if HDFS is not in the finalized state

NAMENODE.name: namenode_cpu
NAMENODE.label: NameNode Host CPU Utilization
NAMENODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if CPU utilization of the NameNode exceeds certain warning and critical thresholds. It checks the NameNode JMX Servlet for the SystemCPULoad property. The threshold values are in percent.

NAMENODE.name: namenode_hdfs_blocks_health
NAMENODE.label: NameNode Blocks Health
NAMENODE.description: This service-level alert is triggered if the number of corrupt or missing blocks exceeds the configured critical threshold. The threshold values are in blocks.

NAMENODE.name: namenode_hdfs_pending_deletion_blocks
NAMENODE.label: HDFS Pending Deletion Blocks
NAMENODE.description: This service-level alert is triggered if the number of blocks pending deletion in HDFS exceeds the configured warning and critical thresholds. It checks the NameNode JMX Servlet for the PendingDeletionBlock property.

NAMENODE.name: namenode_hdfs_capacity_utilization
NAMENODE.label: HDFS Capacity Utilization
NAMENODE.description: This service-level alert is triggered if the HDFS capacity utilization exceeds the configured warning and critical thresholds. It checks the NameNode JMX Servlet for the CapacityUsed and CapacityRemaining properties. The threshold values are in percent.

NAMENODE.name: namenode_rpc_latency
NAMENODE.label: NameNode RPC Latency
NAMENODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the NameNode RPC latency exceeds the configured critical threshold. Typically an increase in the RPC processing time increases the RPC queue length, causing the average queue wait time to increase for NameNode operations. The threshold values are in milliseconds.

ok.text: Average Queue Time:[{0}], Average Processing Time:[{1}]

warning.text: Average Queue Time:[{0}], Average Processing Time:[{1}]

critical.text: Average Queue Time:[{0}], Average Processing Time:[{1}]

NAMENODE.name: namenode_directory_status
NAMENODE.label: NameNode Directory Status
NAMENODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the NameNode NameDirStatuses metric (name=NameNodeInfo/NameDirStatuses) reports a failed directory. The threshold values are in the number of directories that are not healthy.

jmx.value:
calculate(args)
def calculate(args):
  import json
  json_statuses = json.loads({0})
  return len(json_statuses['failed']) if 'failed' in json_statuses else 0

NAMENODE.name: datanode_health_summary
NAMENODE.label: DataNode Health Summary
NAMENODE.description: This service-level alert is triggered if there are unhealthy DataNodes

NAMENODE.name: namenode_last_checkpoint
NAMENODE.label: NameNode Last Checkpoint
NAMENODE.description: This service-level alert will trigger if the last time that the NameNode performed a checkpoint was too long ago. It will also trigger if the number of uncommitted transactions is beyond a certain threshold.

parameters.name: connection.timeout
parameters.description: The maximum time before this alert is considered to be CRITICAL

parameters.name: checkpoint.time.warning.threshold
parameters.description: The percentage of the last checkpoint time greater than the interval in order to trigger a warning alert.

parameters.name: checkpoint.time.critical.threshold
parameters.description: The percentage of the last checkpoint time greater than the interval in order to trigger a critical alert.

NAMENODE.description: This service-level alert is triggered if either the Active NameNode or Standby NameNode are not running.

JOURNALNODE.name: journalnode_process
JOURNALNODE.label: JournalNode Web UI
JOURNALNODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the JournalNode Web UI is unreachable.

DATANODE.name: datanode_process
DATANODE.label: DataNode Process
DATANODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the individual DataNode processes cannot be established to be up and listening on the network.

DATANODE.name: datanode_webui
DATANODE.label: DataNode Web UI
DATANODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the DataNode Web UI is unreachable.

DATANODE.name: datanode_storage
DATANODE.label: DataNode Storage
DATANODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if storage capacity if full on the DataNode. It checks the DataNode JMX Servlet for the Capacity and Remaining properties. The threshold values are in percent.

DATANODE.name: datanode_unmounted_data_dir
DATANODE.label: DataNode Unmounted Data Dir
DATANODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if one of the data directories on a host was previously on a mount point and became unmounted. If the mount history file does not exist, then report an error if a host has one or more mounted data directories as well as one or more unmounted data directories on the root partition. This may indicate that a data directory is writing to the root partition, which is undesirable.

DATANODE.name: datanode_heap_usage
DATANODE.label: DataNode Heap Usage
DATANODE.description: This host-level alert is triggered if heap usage goes past thresholds on the DataNode. It checks the DataNode JMXServlet for the MemHeapUsedM and MemHeapMaxM properties. The threshold values are in percent.

ok.text: Used Heap:[{2:.0f}%, {0} MB], Max Heap: {1} MB

warning.text: Used Heap:[{2:.0f}%, {0} MB], Max Heap: {1} MB

critical.text: Used Heap:[{2:.0f}%, {0} MB], Max Heap: {1} MB

ZKFC.name: hdfs_zookeeper_failover_controller_process
ZKFC.label: ZooKeeper Failover Controller Process
ZKFC.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the ZooKeeper Failover Controller process cannot be confirmed to be up and listening on the network.
